channel.title: Ctf on Software and tech | Kristoffer Lorentsen
channel.description: Recent content in Ctf on Software and tech | Kristoffer Lorentsen

item.title: A Ceasar cipher implemented in Vue.js
item.description: Related to my recent interest in CTF, I’ve spent a little time to implement a simple Ceasar cipher in Vue.js. It allows the user to replace letters with another letter some adjustable number of positions up or down the alphabet. I did this partly because it’s a long time since I’ve done any Vue-related work and also because I find other online Ceasar cipher sites to be a bit clunky and not as user friendly.

item.title: I just did my first SQL injection!
item.description: … and it felt good! This week I spent a couple of hours finding my way through Norwegian Police Security Services new job application which required “hacking” to apply. See the solution on Reddit, GitHub and Kode24. I had a lot of fun trying to figure out the puzzles and it got me excited about learning more. While I liked the challenge, I do tend to like to learn in a more structured way.
